{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2986833,"name":"Will Rueter","username":"wrueter","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/db5fbb/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-08T23:36:16.626Z","cooked":"

Are there FIRST compatible digital compasses that could be used for absolute direction?
The idea is to use absolute direction + vision distance to know a semi-exact location on the field during Auton, since Gyro-drift and path-following accuracy are issues. The vision target this year seems to preclude knowing exact location from vision alone, but if I‚Äôm wrong tell me.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-01-08T23:36:16.626Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":74,"reads":175,"readers_count":174,"score":425.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":399091,"topic_slug":"absolute-direction-digital-compass","display_username":"Will Rueter","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45286,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/absolute-direction-digital-compass/399091/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":2986840,"name":"Dan Katzuv","username":"dan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-08T23:48:15.817Z","cooked":"
wrueter:

Gyro-drift and path-following accuracy are issues

Gyro drift in navX for example is very low (~1¬∞ per minute) so IMO that‚Äôs not an issue.

wrueter:

The vision target this year seems to preclude knowing exact location from vision alone

I might be wrong about that, but I think it will be an issue because the vision targets surround the upper hub, so you can‚Äôt know what side of it you‚Äôre facing.
Maybe if you know from previous measurements where you‚Äôre roughly in the field you can infer what specific vision targets you‚Äôre seeing, but that seems a bit tough.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-01-08T23:48:36.120Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":57.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":399091,"topic_slug":"absolute-direction-digital-compass","display_username":"Dan Katzuv","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32004,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5987 Software Mentor üáÆüá±"},"post_url":"/t/absolute-direction-digital-compass/399091/2","custom_user_title":"5987 Software Mentor üáÆüá±","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2986853,"name":"Will Rueter","username":"wrueter","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/db5fbb/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T00:00:24.535Z","cooked":"

Gyro drift in navX for example is very low (~1¬∞ per minute) so IMO that‚Äôs not an issue.

It might not be just gyro drift, but the error in auton is significant enough that vision is still extremely useful, at least as far as I‚Äôve seen. Maybe I‚Äôm missing something? Just in general I would think it‚Äôs better to have vision than to be flying in the dark.

Maybe if you know from previous measurements where you‚Äôre roughly in the field you can infer what specific vision targets you‚Äôre seeing, but that seems a bit tough.

Fairly certain this is impossible, and at that point you‚Äôre basically using odometry anyway. Maybe though.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T00:00:24.535Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":399091,"topic_slug":"absolute-direction-digital-compass","display_username":"Will Rueter","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":32004,"username":"dan","name":"Dan Katzuv","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45286,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/absolute-direction-digital-compass/399091/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2986856,"name":"Dan Katzuv","username":"dan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T00:03:49.209Z","cooked":"
wrueter:

Just in general I would think it‚Äôs better to have vision than to be flying in the dark.

Of course, but at least during auto, which is short and you‚Äôre safe from colliding with robots, I think you can trust the encoders+gyro combination.

wrueter:

at that point you‚Äôre basically using odometry anyway

True, but you‚Äôd want to combine vision measurements to make your odometry more accurate.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T00:03:49.209Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":37.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":399091,"topic_slug":"absolute-direction-digital-compass","display_username":"Dan Katzuv","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32004,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5987 Software Mentor üáÆüá±"},"post_url":"/t/absolute-direction-digital-compass/399091/4","custom_user_title":"5987 Software Mentor üáÆüá±","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2986862,"name":"Will Rueter","username":"wrueter","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/db5fbb/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T00:08:07.840Z","cooked":"

Of course, but at least during auto, which is short and you‚Äôre safe from colliding with robots, I think you can trust the encoders+gyro combination.

This is probably true. Still interesting to think about. I‚Äôve had some bad experiences with gyros so I‚Äôm just paranoid I guess.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T00:08:07.840Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":30.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":399091,"topic_slug":"absolute-direction-digital-compass","display_username":"Will Rueter","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":32004,"username":"dan","name":"Dan Katzuv","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45286,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/absolute-direction-digital-compass/399091/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2986867,"name":"Julia Schatz","username":"dydx","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dydx/{size}/157851_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T00:18:53.473Z","cooked":"

The NavX (as well as the pigeon) uses a filter to combine magnetic field, gyroscope, and accelerometer data. Dead reckoning from encoders and IMU is more than sufficient for 99% of autonomous modes, if you want position through the entire match you‚Äôll have to include some vision. Some teams used a UKF or EKF for this last year.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T00:19:02.866Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":94,"readers_count":93,"score":38.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":399091,"topic_slug":"absolute-direction-digital-compass","display_username":"Julia Schatz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24286,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Julia Schatz"},"post_url":"/t/absolute-direction-digital-compass/399091/6","custom_user_title":"Julia Schatz","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2986921,"name":"Mykah","username":"ExploitSage","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/exploitsage/{size}/179189_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T01:21:10.089Z","cooked":"

As @dydx said, the NavX and Pigeon IMUs includes a 3-axis Magnetometer (in addition to Gyro and Accelerator), and I know for the NavX at least the Java Docs show you can both get the ‚ÄúCompass‚Äù heading or the raw values for each of the sensors, so that would work for you. I‚Äôve never looked at the Pigeon IMU‚Äôs documentation.

About 8 years ago I used a HMC5883L I2C 3-axis Magnetometer board with an Arduino in a project that rotated a platform to face the user using two sets of GPS Coords (the location of the user, and the platform). This worked well, and while there isn‚Äôt pre-exisiting WPILib (or LabVIEW) code for it, the library looked pretty straight forward and easy to port. Here is the Arduino code and library I used for that project.

Though it sounds like we may want to be wary of using the Onboard I2C Port due to a known WPILib bug where the system may lock up using it. Workaround sounding like using the MXP port I2C port.

https://pdocs.kauailabs.com/navx-mxp/guidance/terminology/

Based on this, the compass heading is accurate within 2 degrees.

We are also wondering how to conquer this mini-problem. In the past, we would first line up against the wall hit the reset, then align put the robot where needed.

This year we are thinking either take the compass heading or line up with one of the ‚Äútrapezoid‚Äù lines and build in an offset to our robot angle.
